results.title: Early childhood
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personality”.
The experiences of pre-school children play a role in all aspects of their personality development. While there are many personality traits developing during this age period, several are of special significance: dependence, identification, aggression, fear and anxiety.

results.title: Early Amateur Sound Film (1936–37)
results.brief_description: Amateur filmmaker Archie Stewart used an RCA Sound Camera to document family life from 1935. A member of the Amateur Cinema League, in 1937 he published one of the first articles on amateur sound, ‘A Talkie Movie Maker Speaks’, in the league’s magazine.

constellations_other.name: Amateur hour
constellations_other.description: Early sound equipment allowed filmmakers and amateurs alike the ability to experiment often with affordable 16mm film.

results.title: Early abortion
results.brief_description: Uses scenes from a question-and-answer session and from an abortion procedure in order to explain a typical atravmatic abortion procedure. Narrated by Adrienne Barbeau and animation by Robert Greenberg

results.title: Earl of Home
results.creator_credit: British Information Services and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Commonwealth Teleview”.
In an interview with Robert McKenzie, the Earl of Home, Britain’s Secretary of State for Commonwealth Relations, discusses present and future trends of the British Commonwealth and talks about some of the links and common aims that bind this family of nations together.

results.title: Eager to write: Lorraine Wilson
results.creator_credit: Andrew Scollo and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: Dicusses the ways in which children learn to write and how children who find writing difficult can be encouraged and taught. Features many of the ideas of Lorraine Wilson.

results.title: Each one is different
results.brief_description: This film is designed to show how individual differences in children can be catered for in a primary school. The film is basically relevant to physical education programs.

results.title: E E Cummings: the making of a poet
results.brief_description: Traces the poetic growth of E. E. Cummings, using his own voice, poetry paintings, drwaings and notebooks. Poems included are: ‘Thank You God For Most This Amazing’, ‘If There Are Any Heavens My Mother’, ‘In Just Spring’, ‘Life Is More True Than Reason Will Deceive’, ‘Paris’, “The April Sunset Completely Utters’, ‘Carry Your Heart With Me’ and others. The narration is adapted from ‘Six Nonlectures’ by E. E. Cummings recorded at Havard University.
results.title_for_label: E E Cummings: the making of a poet
results.description: Traces the poetic growth of E. E. Cummings, using his own voice, poetry paintings, drwaings and notebooks. Poems included are: ‘Thank You God For Most This Amazing’, ‘If There Are Any Heavens My Mother’, ‘In Just Spring’, ‘Life Is More True Than Reason Will Deceive’, ‘Paris’, “The April Sunset Completely Utters’, ‘Carry Your Heart With Me’ and others. results.title: Dynasties
results.creator_credit: Stephen Ramsey, Tim Clark and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Using rare archival footage, photographs and interviews, we are privy to family life and relationships of seven of Australia’s most powerful families. Nineteenth and twentieth century Australian history has been formed by some of the influence of these families - pastoralists, philanthropists, politicians and journalists - and some of their influence on society continues today. Families are: Murdoch, Downer, Wright, Myer, Durack, De Bortolis, and Macarthur. Two-disc set containing seven episodes from Series One of this fascinating ABC TV Documentary series. Narrated by William Zappa.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stephen Ramsey, Tim Clark and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
